title: Thumb or index finger? Any fingerprint can be used to vote in Nigeria’s elections
subtitle: Nigeria’s presidential elections are set for 16 February 2019.

It continues: “You vote with your INDEX FINGER (warning finger). Any vote cast with the THUMB is VOID (cancelled) vote.”

Any fingerprint can be used to vote

Nigeria’s Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) warns in a statement that the message is false.

“INEC’s attention has been drawn to fake news making rounds that the index finger is the only finger approved for marking a ballot paper. This is FALSE.”

Any fingerprint can be used to vote, so Nigeria’s voters shouldn’t worry about the hoax.

“At the point of registration, all 10 fingers were captured,” INEC says. “So any finger can be used for marking a ballot paper. Make sure that your that your mark is inside the box of your party of choice and does not stray into another box.”
